SENT.plain: Dural sinus thrombosis developed in two children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia during induction treatment with vincristine sulfate, prednisone, and asparaginase
Headache, nausea, emesis, and lethargy were the presenting signs
The diagnosis was confirmed by arteriography
The cause is presumed to be secondary to hypercoagulability due to asparaginase-induced antithrombin III deficiency
The patients received anticoagulation therapy and recovered completely
Only two of the six reported patients without heparinization survived
